website_summaries.verdict: Quirks aside, this is an economical pick with features and reliability similar to costlier models. The one to pick if you're watching your budget.
pros: Offers capabilities similar to more costly models, including heart rate monitoring, easy syncing with most devices, and tracking of numerous functions
cons: Users with large wrists may find the band too slim
Occasional reports of lost data due to spontaneous resets

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and keeps me active
customer_reviews.text: I work with Computer and on my desk for 10-12 hours a day. This fitness tracker (Lintelek) reminds me every 15-20 minutes to move my body and stretch. My daily step activities have increased multi-fold after started to wear this getting me closer to my 10,000 steps per day goal. It also accurately tracks my sleep. Not only it is Fitness Tracker, Heart Rate Monitor, Activity Tracker, Pedometer Watch with Connected GPS, it alerts me when I am getting a text message, phone etc, giving a choice to hang up on spam Robocalls, right from my wrist. Will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: M B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Fitness Tracker for the Price
customer_reviews.text: So far I have really enjoyed this fitness tracker. I bought it in hopes that it would motivate me to get more exercise, and it has. I have put in daily walks all week. The sleep monitor breaks down your sleep pattern into light and deep sleep and information is stored on the app, so you can see your progress throughout the week. Overall, a very good investment -- especially given the cost of comparable trackers.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy S.

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: I did research before ordering this fitness tracker as I was trying to spend as little as possible and still get a decent device. This device came up as best bang for your buck (less than $30). Up until this purchase I had not been this satisfied with anything less than a Fitbit. My last Fitbit had just run its course after 4 years and I needed a new one. I gave it 4 stars for sleep and accuracy because it does not track my awake time properly. Other than that it seems to be accurate and had all the bells and whistles I want.
customer_reviews.author: mkjanational arboretum  eagle

customer_reviews.title: Good Replacement for Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for fitness tracker device but I didn't wanted to spend too much money so I ordered this Fitness Tracker. Overall I am impress with the product and I must admit it is Cheap and Best. Though there is slight glitch with accuracy but it is minimal. Battery Life is awesome and it is easy to charge. Stylish and comfortable. I can track Steps,Calories , sleep cycles , Running,Walking and biking. Good Replacement for Fitbit. Easy to connect with iPhone App. Best thing is we don't need to keep the bluetooth on every time. Whenever we want to sync the data with app at that point we need to turn on the bluetooth and Sync the data.
customer_reviews.author: @jitKumar

customer_reviews.title: Not for serious exercisers
customer_reviews.text: This is not for the serious fitness person. It only has walk run and bike mode. I tried walk mode. I did an hour of circuit comprised of plyometrics and weight training. Since it thought I only walked a mile according to how many steps it tracked it gave me a calorie consumption of139. Although it showed my heart rate often during the workout being over160 bmp.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy S.

customer_reviews.title: works really good for little money
customer_reviews.text: My wife uses this for steps. It does have a heart rate monitor, but she doesn't use that. As far as accuracy, it is very close to my Garmin. There is a difference, but my stride is longer, so it makes sense she has a few more steps. The only thing that is weird is you have to take off the lower wrist band to charge. I wonder if eventually the wrist band will have to be replaced and not sure I can get one. It only charges once a week, so it should last a long time. IT is nice to be able to charge on any usb port.
customer_reviews.author: pynewbie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to operate; good price point
customer_reviews.text: A decent step tracker that has held up well. It's the first one I've owned and I didn't want anything fancy or complicated. Easy to operate and gives me all the info I need. It requires recharging every five days or so, but that's easy to do. This tracker connects with the FitPro app and, unfortunately, isn't compatible with the MyFitnessPal app, which I use extensively. For the price, however, it serves my purposes well.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Let down.
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed. The step count is off, the heart rate is incorrect, and calorie count is horrible. It says I burned 240 calories during an intensive 45 minute spin class! It’s so inaccurate. Also, the manual was clearly written by someone who does not speak English as a first language. It’s difficult to follow and lacks description. I’ll be returning this item!
customer_reviews.author: Tormoen

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after having 2 fit bits. Never used either of them. This is pretty simple to use once it’s synced up. (I couldn’t get the device to link to my phone at first). Tracks well. Not so great on sleep. Counts the time you are laying awake as light sleep. The problem I have with it is the wrist band needs to be pulled off one side of the unit so it can be charged. (Charger is not included). I think I’m going to break the band getting it off. There has to be a better way of charging these devices. Purchase an adapter under you have a spare
customer_reviews.author: MacAdoo

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money. very limited features & not accurate or dependable
customer_reviews.text: After using this device for several days, I find it to be very inaccurate with limited feature information. My Fitbit that was provided by my insurance company was so much better. I only use this device for sleep, steps and BPM and none of these are accurate nor do they provide detailed information. Many times I tap it in the correct place on the face numerous times to before I get a display. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: M Francis

customer_reviews.title: Thrilled! Lintelek Fitness Tracker Heart Rate Monitor, Activity Tracker+
customer_reviews.text: I am thrilled with my purchase of the Lintelek Fitness Tracker. It does more than my Fitbit (didn't have the top of the line). It is accurate for tracking long walk/runs. I really like being able to check my heart rate. When you start an activity (walking) it will run through all the tracking points! The sleep mode is amazing. It tracks both deep sleep, light sleep and minutes you are awake during your down time! It even shows a different screen at night! It also generates a celebration on screen when you make 10K steps for day.I am very happy with my purchase of Lintelek- great product especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Edye

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: This fitness tracker is everything I was looking for at an affordable price. The app associated with it could use a bit more work but the device itself is great. I can change the settings to track my various workouts from dancing to biking to even using my treadmill. I have noticed that sometimes the step counter is a little off but not enough for me to complain about. I also found that mine stopped tracking my sleep a few days after I started using it but for me thats not a big deal since I don't care to sleep with it anyway. I'm planning to buy a few more as Christmas gifts since the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my daughter one for her birthday. It worked well the first two weeks, so I bought one for myself. Well... then hers slowly stopping counting her steps, then wouldn't connect to the app. I deleted the app and set it up again but nothing helped. I got mine and it did the exact same thing. Absolutely not worth it. I wouldn't take one if it was offered to me for free. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!! Fitbit is definitely worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: jill

customer_reviews.title: Counting of steps way off
customer_reviews.text: Thought I would try this before going for the Fitbit, NOT worth it. Just get the Fitbit and be done with it. This watch kept great time and I still use it as a watch, slim and fits nicely. Step count was always was off....much higher than my iphone was tracking...almost double at times. I kept the watch on my left hand as recommended (I am right handed) and my iphone on my left hip, you would think the iphone would have been on the higher side being on my hip but the watch count was always much, much higher.
customer_reviews.author: Susan D.

customer_reviews.title: Completely inaccurate fitness tracking.
customer_reviews.text: TERRIBLE at heart rate monitoring! I did HIIT training today and a walk. It said my hr was higher on my walk.... I could barely catch my breath during HIIT train and was not even winded on my walk. Completely inaccurate. I also looked at it WHILE WALKING and it wasn’t even counting steps on several occasions. Do NOT waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica L. Warren

customer_reviews.title: I can't get it to charge.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these and both times, I cannot get the USB to take a charge. I have tried multiple USB ports and nothing works. . In addition, I have arthritis in my hands and pulling the USB away from the wrist band was painful. I don't recommend this product at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased With Performance & Price Would Buy It Again
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased this for my wife to replace a more expensive tracker to pair with her iPhone. She has been very pleased with its performance so I decided to purchase one to pair with my iPad and am also happy with its performance, accuracy and ease of use and display of results using the iPad. We primarily use them for step count, walking, heartbeat, sleep tracking and of course to tell time. We would definitely purchase them again and recommend them. PS, great customer service I had a quick response to a question.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Only good for counting steps
customer_reviews.text: Pluses: - Seems to track steps pretty accurately - Costs very little compared to other brands - Battery life is reasonable - Easy to charge (no adapter needed) Minuses: - The app is a mess; most of the data and charts make no sense whatsoever. The data is inconsistent and the charts show a down trend when the data is actually increasing. - Sleep tracking is absolutely worthless - No way that I could find to change km, cm setting to miles, inches
customer_reviews.author: anniemo

customer_reviews.title: Great Fitness Tracker
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tracker because I started walking every day and my pedometer app on my phone was not accurately tracking my steps. This tracker has worked perfectly from the moment I received it. It allows me to start the walking function easily, tracks me and my location, heart rate, calories burned, and how long it took me to complete while keeping perfect accuracy. It tells me in steps, miles and kilometers. I look forward to when I can start using the running function.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Staten

customer_reviews.title: Great but with flaws
customer_reviews.text: Item is great. Wife is happy with. Does everything it’s suppose to. BUT! The app/Bluetooth is a P.I.A. It keeps getting dropped. Then trying to get it reconnected is a P.I.A. Keep getting “wrong pin passkey. HUH!!! I get better Bluetooth connection on ear buds, speakers, etc... my wife doesn’t mind it, but you pay for it. It should work. Plus time is in military time. We’re not military people. Can’t change time. It seems that it will to Bluetooth when connected to WiFi.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: So great! Definitely a steal
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wanting to get back into fitness for a long time, and knew that I needed a fitness watch to motivate myself. I didn’t have $100+ to spend on a name brand FitBit, and this watch has fantastic reviews so I decided on it. I have not been disappointed in the slightest. It is easy to use, easy to read, and the layout of the cell phone app is superb. I especially love tracking my sleep and seeing how long I’m in a deep sleep for vs a light sleep. This has been great for my fitness journey, and I’m hoping to buy one of my dad soon, too!
customer_reviews.author: Molly Collins

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned a Fitbit Charge but the battery died in my 3 year old Fitbit and was going to cost me ~$70 to have a new battery installed. So I decided I would replaced the Fitbit with a less expensive fitness tracker. Wow, was I surprised! This Lintelek worked great the first time I used it and I didn't have to spend hours trying to figure it out. The operation is very intuitive and reliable. I should have bought the Lintelek sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Very good app, very iffy tracking accuracy
customer_reviews.text: The app that this uses is very good, and the mobile to tracker functions are great. The tracker itself seems to be a bit off though. The steps counter is a good bit different from a fitbit that was used, as it appears to not count anything under 20-30 steps. It tracks them, then just drops them if it's not a high enough count. I've found the heartbeat counter to be in the ballpark and the sleep tracker to be usable. The exercise tracker leaves a lot to be desired for me. You get what you pay for though.
customer_reviews.author: Black Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Fitness Band
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this band because it was advertised that exercise, heart rate, and sleep were all part of the package. I have not figured out how to make the sleep function work. The app hasn't been user friendly. I have a difficult time finding the weight login, which is also part of the functions available. As for recording steps, I feel the band does a decent job of getting it right. There is a place on the app to set your step length. Overall, I'm glad I have the band.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate. No flexible. App is annoying. Overall, very poor product
customer_reviews.text: Didn't measure my heart rate accurately (compared to manual count by two doctors and an independent device)...can be a major disadvantage for people trying to hit certain fitness goals or even dangerous for people who can't have their heart rate go above a certain limit. Not sure how it is so bad in this era where most simple $10 watches an measures your heart rata. I tried returning but UPS never picked up as scheduled and I left state for a while so now stuck with it...can't even sell it in good conscious. Trash. Shame. #Amazonfail
customer_reviews.author: Amer Homsi

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical because it's off brand and most times its problem. Two months in and I still love it. I do debate the accuracy for the sleep and steps but overall it's worth it. I'd definitely recommend give it try if you want something to keep track of steps. sleep, and heart rate. With the steps if you use that arm a lot, it may not be an accurate step count. I'm not sure how it monitors deep sleep versus awake time, so I can't say it's accurate or not.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Wait until they get these fitnesstrackers working for adults
customer_reviews.text: It functions as well as any of these devices do I suppose. I have decided never to buy another one including if it is Fitbit or apple because all of the reviews have the same complaints. Inaccurate step readings...you need your phone near you to keep the results recorded...I work nights the sleep function does not work for my sleep times....all in all these are toys at best....overpriced even at thirty dollars let alone Fitbit and apple prices...
customer_reviews.author: bethany

customer_reviews.title: Sleep tracking feature quit working, saying “ No data” each morning
customer_reviews.text: At first I liked it . I bought for the sleep tracking feature. It worked for one week , then in the morning it would say “no data”. I rebooted and cleared the cache three times. For thee nights it would record between 3 am and 7, then went back to “no data” . Heart rate and time and date were accurate, which is all I wanted. Battery lasted 7 days as stated. Nice design and comfortable. But sent back because I needed sleep data. Tried contacting company on their app and website, but nobody called back. Cannot read watch in sunlight which is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: best Product for Price
customer_reviews.text: this is best product I ever seen for fitness tracker and mobile friendly its work much better then most costly watch for price I Paid I really like this watch my son also love it on his wrist I order three different wrist colors bands for this watches its charge so fast and last charge long enough only bad part is it not come with charger but most people has usb charger and its work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this watch a few days. I wish I had not thrown the box it came in or I’d return it. It only measures my steps if I’m swinging my arms. Not The steps of walking my granddaughter in her stroller, walking around carrying her to put her to sleep. So, you get what you pay for, a cheap watch that at least tells the time correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Tina M

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have had this tracker for over a month & I couldn’t be more pleased. I had a Garmin for 4 years & it didn’t do half of what this little jewel does. It not only gives the time & date it tracks my steps, tells me to move, heart monitor and the best part, it alerts me when I have a call & tells me who is calling if they are one of my contacts. I am not athletic so I can’t give an opinion on the run or bike option but if it’s like the walk feature it’s probably just as good. I would buy this little gem in a heartbeat if I lost mine.
customer_reviews.author: Pink Duck

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect...
customer_reviews.text: For the price worth it. This watch is almost perfect if it wasn’t for the inaccurate bpm. My bpm whether sitting, standing or moving jumps all over the place. One sec I’ll see 60 bpm then the next thing I know it spiked to 90bpm. This inaccuracy will probably result in other inaccurate data. Other then that the watch is perfect and a lot of things to do with it. I love the alarm feature and the different training programs on it. Easy to use and easy to install. App is very simple as well. If you don’t care much for accurate bpm then I recommend this affordable watch.
customer_reviews.author: DonPorag

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations! Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item because I needed something to track my steps/sleep and tell time. This item has exceeded my expectations!! The battery life is long lasting! The app is intuitive and easy to use! It’s sleek and slim design is comfortable and on trend. The only thing I would change is potential improvements to the wrist sense in future models. Other than that this is amazing quality at an affordable price!
customer_reviews.author: Shaye

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Doesn't stay connected to my phone. It's extremely inaccurate. 45 mins on a stairmaster and my heat rate was 56. Yea, ok. Sleep doesn't work. Just a waste of money. I'm not sure how this thing gets so many great review.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Great Accuracy
customer_reviews.text: I don't use the sleep tracking or mobile app, but it's the most accurate watch I've worn. I had a FitBit that stopped working years ago, so I decided to hop on Amazon and buy this. I just wanted a step counter to keep me motivated and I love this one! It stays charged WAY longer than my FitBit ever did. If you're a person who isn't willing to fork out $ for an Apple Watch, this is the right move.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Port

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: As soon as you put it on, you realize it is lightweight and comfortable to wear. Nice fitness tracker for the price. I’m trying to be more active and have been curious about how much I’m walking and my heart rate. And I hit the gym three a week and this little gem has really enhanced the experience.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Mijangos

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: This watch does not work. When I checked it an hour ago, it said “245 steps”. I checked it 30 minutes later, it said “0 steps”. I just got back from a long walk and it said “90 steps”. And as I’m typing this review, I checked it again and it’s back at “0 steps”. I’ve set it up through the app and everything and it still does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This tracker does not do what it is supposed to do. Does not measure the steps correctly and grossly overestimates heart rate at rest (114). That makes me doubt the numbers it gives me during exercise. Invest in a better/name brand device. Update: When exercising, my avg heart beat is 64 :/
customer_reviews.author: DLC

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner tracker for the $
customer_reviews.text: This little device tracks steps, walking, running and biking. It also tracks your bpm, but if not worn correctly can be off. The app on your mobile will track weight. This is perfect for someone starting out and determining if this is a device they will use to track their progress. This is not the device for the hard core athlete, but you knew that from the description. If you are looking to start tracking your progress towards a new you, and are on a budget or wondering if a device like this is for you, I recommend this for you.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn K Mowrey

customer_reviews.title: Lintelek Hands More Bang For Your Buck!!,
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Lintelek watch/app for approximately two weeks. Due to the low low price my expectations were that it would do the job but not much else. To my surprise after using for a two weeks I love this tracker and it’s app. It has all the functionality of its more expensive competitors and works seemlessly with my smartphone. I had a Fitbit tracker prior to the Lintelek that I paid approximately $80 for and the Lintelek watch/app are much more robust and a lot less expensive. Hands down purchase the Lintelek over Fitbit. You will be happy you did and have enough money left over compared to the Fitbit to take your girl to a nice restaurant!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mors

customer_reviews.title: Small Wrists.. fits in the last hole
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunally after 6 months it stopped holding charge. If you get this product go to their website & sign up for their warranty. Now I am stuck with a dead fitness tracker. But... I did Love how my phone syns to it for phone calls. Pretty accurate... but most fitbits arent 100% true on steps. Still waiting on reply from company for a possible return.
customer_reviews.author: Healthy4Life

customer_reviews.title: Much nicer than expected!
customer_reviews.text: The lower price worried me a bit, but it has proven to be a great tracker!! I wish I knew if it keeps track of more than just one day - I would like to see an overview of maybe a week, but I haven't been able to research that yet. Otherwise, the battery is amazing, it seems to be very accurate and I would highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Great, Inexpensive activity tracker/smartwatch
customer_reviews.text: This is a great inexpensive alternative to the pricier Fitbit and Apple Watch. I use it to track my steps and heart rate. I love the fact that I’m able to see text messages and caller ID info without having to pull out my phone. The battery lasts at least a week per charge. Another great feature is that you can charge it right from your computer! I do not shower or bathe while wearing it so I can’t attest to the water resistance. I have purchased two of these and recommended to family members.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie R. Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a less expensive replacement for my broken Fitbit HR. This is perfect. It actually pairs with my phone easier than my Fitbit did. Both the tracker and the app are easy to use. I love pairing it with my phone and recieving notifications about calls and texted The only reason I gave it 4 stars is that the heart rate monitor is not always accurate. It’s fairly accurate when reading my resting heartrate but not when working out. During an intense fitness class, where my heart rate is usually 140-160, it read 84.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel disimile

customer_reviews.title: Good quality at a good price
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a great product. I found wearing it on my left arm vs. right allows for it to give a more accurate heart rate reading. The sleep feature has been accurate since day 2. I'm not sure what happened day 1, but since then it shows correct information. For the price it does what I want it to with just as accurate readings as the more expensive options.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Schory

customer_reviews.title: Quit Working
customer_reviews.text: It worked reasonably well for a month and then just quit connecting to my iPhone. My Bluetooth no longer can connect to it.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: I like the built in USB for charging purposes. I don't like that I have to touch and hold to read the heartbeat monitor, the step tracker etc. I'd like this deck monitor just to be on the face of the clock and continually track my steps Without having to search for it. I've only had it for A-day so I will do another video after a week or so and see if I like it better.
customer_reviews.author: susan l

customer_reviews.title: Okay product, good price
customer_reviews.text: So I question the accuracy. When at the gym it never has same heart rate or step count as the machines. Also would say my sleep tracking seems off. I do not sleep great, but this seems way off always saying I only get 30min of deep sleep each night. But, the reviews for way more expensive fitbits and other products seem worse.
customer_reviews.author: OneofaKindBulldogs

customer_reviews.title: Less money with all functions I need!
customer_reviews.text: I love this Fitbit, wear every day. Affordable price, I don’t need spend over $150 to get the Fitbit with same functions. I use it mostly for tracking how many steps I walk daily, my goal is 8000 steps and the alarm function is nice, only wake me up without disturbing other people. I definitely will recommend it .
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. Very impressed with the quality of this product considering it's a fraction of the price of a fitbit. I just needed something to monitor my steps, distance, and heart rate. Seems like it's very accurate. It's extremely comfortable and lightweight. I love the way it fits. Already telling my family members to get the same one! Love the way it notifies you as soon as you hit 10,000 steps too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meatloaf 2 out of 4 not bad
customer_reviews.text: For the money it's a great little fitness watch you can't beat it. Time is spot on and the tracker works great it seems fairly accurate. The sleep tracker said I slept for over 12 hrs. I don't think so. The HR at times is good and others not so good. So 2 out of four not bad they are the main reason I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts about this watch. It sure showed me. It's a great watch. Battery last almost 2 weeks before I have to charge it. I like seeing how much I walk in the day time and my heart rate. I will recommend this to all my friends. Worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Renee Reid

customer_reviews.title: Love it and if you have a question on the sleep tracking, read this.
customer_reviews.text: Love this!!!!! So easy to use and setup. Note: on the sleeping section. You cannot set it up. To activate, you need to be laying flat and after 30 minutes it will start recording. Since I toss and turn a lot, it counts steps since I move my arm a lot. Also, if you get up let's say to go to the bathroom, it will start over after 30 minutes of laying flat again.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Wade

customer_reviews.title: It's great for telling the date and time.
customer_reviews.text: Well the time is correct and the date. The steps are off by thousands btw incase you buy this and are totally dissapointed in your step count. I compared it to a Fitbit borrowed from a friend and a regular pedometer. The heart rate etc might be fine but unfortunately I have no trust in those numbers now. It does hold a charge pretty long.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer K.

customer_reviews.title: Guess you get what you pay for. Disappointed over all
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cause if the rating. Got one for myself and one for the wife. She loves her mine never works right. Bought for the sleep tracker and out of five nights it tracked one. Even that was a let down as it only cought a few hours of my 8 hours in bed. Over all you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: Great sleek watch with Fitbit capabilities, but the app is garbage.
customer_reviews.text: The watch is good for tracking steps and heart rate. The display and functionality are great for exercise. It is sweat and waterproof. I wash my hands often, wear it while swimming, and have even worn it in the shower. Still working great after 4 months of using it in the hot sweaty summer in The South. The App is garbage. Data, watch, and phone will not sync. I've done everything in the instruction book to no avail. I've since deleted the app, and used the watch as a very cheap Fitbit disguised a cheap watch.
customer_reviews.author: B.Solo.

customer_reviews.title: Really great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: The accuracy isn't perfect, but it's beyond good enough for the cost. I haven't had skin issues, which was a concern of mine. Charges fast, charge lasts for probably 4-5 days. I love that it tracks steps and sleep AND displays texts and calls (albeit texts are a little wonky looking). I've had mine for a few months now and I love it. I'd definitely buy it again and recommend it to anyone on a less than FitBit budget!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Fitness Tracker!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Lintelek Fitness tracker! It works perfectly for a very reasonable price compared to the big brand names. I have really enjoyed tracking my steps, blood pressure, workouts and sleep activity. Very simple to use and it’s very accurate! I also track my bike riding activity as well. If you are thinking about buying a fitness tracker consider this one!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn D.

customer_reviews.title: Surprisedly Accurate.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this watch the first week I got it, I was pleasantly surprised by how accurate the sleep tracking is. I loved it so much I purchased one for my husband. It really motivates us to move and get our steps up everyday. We also love scary movies and have enjoyed seeing the heart rate during non work out moments.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqi Of All Trades

customer_reviews.title: three big problems
customer_reviews.text: In general, a good product, but I found three big problems: 1. incredibly difficult to charge: to do this, you have to disconnect the strap from the watch every time. 2. The strap gave me a strong allergy. 3. Inaccurately counts steps: even when you wash your hands, counts as steps.
customer_reviews.author: Sevara

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: The tracking works great if in a mode such as long walk. However, it tracks very few steps outside of a long walk mode. Also, will not connect to other apps like My Fitness Pal. Returning it, and spending a little more for a Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: Spring

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product at an awesome price.
customer_reviews.text: Received my new Lintelek fitness tracker yesterday and and I was pleasantly surprised at the quality and looks. I followed the instructions and put it on charge. It took about 20 minutes to reach a full charge as noted. Put the band on with no problems and it is so comfortable on my wrist. I followed the instructions setting up the app and Bluetooth in about 10 minutes. I wore it to work today and couldn’t stop showing it off, and it still has 89 percent battery charge. Thank you Lintelek for a great product at a more than fair price. Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great until a month later...
customer_reviews.text: It worked great when I was using it! However after having it for only month, it completely shut down. It won't charge, it won't turn on, and no lights will turn on. Disappointed at the short life-span.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Porter

customer_reviews.title: Great Value Fitness Tracker but Not Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This tracker works and pairs with your smartphone very well. For under 30 bucks the value is great. Sleep monitor seems to be accurate. However, if you are buying this for accurate heart rate monitoring, for me, it is often inaccurate, particularly when your wrist is sweaty. I have been looking for alternative watches because of this as heart rate monitoring is the most important feature to me.
customer_reviews.author: Long John

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement
customer_reviews.text: I honestly needed a replacement for my FitBit. I am quite pleased with this. The band doesn't irritate my skin whereas FitBit gave me a rash. The app tracks my sleep. I think the band counts washing dishes as steps though. Might be too sensitive.
customer_reviews.author: New York Wife, Mom, and Student

customer_reviews.title: stopped working after less than 3 mos
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the fitness tracker. It is simple to use. Not a lot of functions but perfect for my needs. Sadly, it will no longer take a charge. I have contacted the manufacturer and hope that they will send me a replacement watch. We'll see.
customer_reviews.author: Faranah

customer_reviews.title: Love this watch
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. I don't use all the features. It lights up at night and bothers me so I don't sleep in it. but I love knowing my phone is ringing or I have messages. Battery lasts a long time. charges quickly. I do use the step counter.
customer_reviews.author: BebeeTaur

customer_reviews.title: Oftentimes Doesn't Log Activity
customer_reviews.text: I like the item overall, however, the activity will track on the device and then not sync on the app no matter how many times I refresh. I have to write down the calories burned and then end the activity by rebooting. It's pretty frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with Lintelek Fitness Tracker!
customer_reviews.text: Compared to its competitors, Lintelek trackers can be considered as high-quality products at a competitive price for the market. Its app, VeryFitPro, is user friendly and easy to navigate and understand, with a clean and nice interface. As a user of a similar model for almost a year now, the ID115Plus HR, Lintelek has been able to satisfy my needs without having any technical issues. The only point that I would raise is in relation to the compatibility of different models' wristbands, since my ID115Plus HR wristband, unfortunately, doesn't fit perfectly well my new ID130Plus HR. Nevertheless, it is a minor issue that doesn't bother that much.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe P.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tracker
customer_reviews.text: This is my first fitness tracker so I was a little behind about learning how to use it. It is so simple to set up with my phone. The battery life is fantastic, I wear it 24/7 and charge up about once a week. I love the adjustable band. It is able to fit my husband's huge wrist, my wrist and even my 5 year olds. I also wear it while doing dishes or bathing my kids with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Comfortable fit.
customer_reviews.text: It’s late lightweight and so far waterproof. Showers and rain didn’t have any detrimental effects. The heart rate monitor seems a bit off but the other functions work well. It pairs great with my iPhone and The messages and phone calls are a great addition. You can dismiss calls from the watch and scroll the message. Well with the low price point
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product for the price. I don't like that if I sit still like at the movies it logs me as being asleep. Also if I am shopping and have both hands on the shopping cart it does not count a lot of the steps I take.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t track my sleep
customer_reviews.text: I have two complaints, one is, sometimes the heart rate is way the hell off. My heart rate is not 147 when I stand up. The other complaint is that it stops tracking my sleep at 7am. Now this may be ok for you normal sleepers, but my sleep schedule is usually from 3am-11am. The main reason I chose this one is cos of price and the fact that it had a sleep tracker. I’m very disappointed in this.
customer_reviews.author: BrooklynGal

customer_reviews.title: Heart rate function wildly inaccurate.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed that the heart rate function was useless; it started showing a reasonable rate, but then spontaneously increased to double or more. Tried it several times, but it continued to ramp up. Too bad, it was a great price if it only worked.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these for my family and only 1 out of 3 works properly. I have used mine for almost 2 months - during that time it has malfunctioned several times and will not hold a charge. Today it just stopped working all together Don't waste your money -
customer_reviews.author: Melero728

customer_reviews.title: This will help you to get moving.
customer_reviews.text: I’m very pleased with my purchase. I’ve had the product for 5 days. I charged it up right out of the box, as per the instructions, and it didn’t take long to get a full charge. I scanned the QR code on the box and easily downloaded the app. Other than removing it to shower, I’ve been wearing it nonstop. I’m not 💯% sure that the step count is accurate but it certainly motivates me to keep moving until I reach 10,000 steps everyday. I would fully recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: For the price this product is great! I bought this to use until I get a new charger for my Fitbit and it tracks pretty close to what my Fitbit normally gets! The mobile app is touch and go sometimes.. it may take a few minutes to update or the watch and app disconnect so it doesn’t record your workout 😔Definitely could use a makeover (I have an IPhone). I still like it enough to recommend to friends who are budgeting during this tough time! This is a budget FRIENDLY fitness accessory!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan B.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth money
customer_reviews.text: After having it for a few days it stopped working properly. It does not accurately track sleep anymore
customer_reviews.author: Paulette H

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a giant POS. It tracked everything for 3 days then wouldn't sync or track or connect to the app.
customer_reviews.author: kinch

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Junk, wont stay connected to phone. Wont accurately track sleep. If you get up to go to the bathroom through the night it cuts off your sleep for the night. Doesnt accurately count steps through the day either. Always 400 to 500 differce between it and the step counter on my phone. Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Rick Willey

customer_reviews.title: Is this too good to be true?
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought this was too good to be true, but I decided to take a chance and was very pleased! This product is very helpful. I really wanted something to help with tracking my sleep and steps. This even shows not just how long I slept but also, how much deep sleep and light sleep I got. It does so many other things too but I know you have read all the other features already in the description area above. It was really easy to set up (once I read the directions). I thoroughly enjoy this product! Very affordable! 10/10 would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with very fit pro
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with my very fit pro! Only 1 thing would please me more is for it to be compatible with my healow application. My primary physician can monitor me from the healow application.
customer_reviews.author: George R. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Do your homework before purchasing
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I recieved it and my screen had a crack in it. Secondly it's not accurate at all probably because of the screen being damaged. Not a happy camper money wasted
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Sanford

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Great if you want a digital watch, pretty much useless if you want it to do anything else. The pedometer doesn't work, I logged over 3000 steps in my sleep? The heartbeat monitor is basically a random number generator. Go with a more proven brand. It might cost more but it'll work.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Leland

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product! Long battery life, and pretty good fitness tracker.
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome! The battery life is pretty long, it's been about a week and a half and I still don't have a low battery notification. The only thing is the step counter is a little sensitive, it counted me folding clothes as taking steps, but that's really the only thing, and I'm sure there's somewhere in the app to change that.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the money
customer_reviews.text: This little watch works very well for my use. Wish it had BP and oxygen options. But for the price, it is very good. Could have been made easier to charge the battery. I get about a week out of a charge.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Myers

customer_reviews.title: Great for step and sleep counting
customer_reviews.text: Loved that it tracked my steps and my sleep patterns, also loved its bluetooth ability to send my Lintelek notifications that i'm getting on my phone, only negative thing I have to say is I had the FitBit 2 prior to this and loved how accurate the calorie tracker was with the amount of calories I was burning throughout the day and also each time I worked out, so I knew exactly how much to consume. I don't believe my Lintelek tracker is as accurate as my fitbit or monitors at the same rate so that is something I'm getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Williams

customer_reviews.title: WOW! Excellent Fitness Tracker and Affordable
customer_reviews.text: We needed some motivation to start walking daily and this was the ticket. Its affordability opened the door for us, but we were sold at the ease of setup and the accuracy of the product. Very sleek looking with great battery life. I would recommend to all of my friends and at this price I think that I will be giving these away at Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Parrott

customer_reviews.title: Instructions to operate
customer_reviews.text: I liked the product, but it would not sync with my phone the way I expected. I could not set the time, so my steps kept restarting in the middle of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Alesia

customer_reviews.title: May not do well at a lot of things
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old Fitbit zip. I bought it because of the price and number of functions. I found that when I walked a number of steps they were not recorded correctly. I also didn't use most of the features. The software did not connect to the lose it app and wasn't nearly as intuitive as the Fitbit app. I ended up getting a low end Fitbit because it does well at the few things I really want and it connects to the lose it app.
customer_reviews.author: Cori

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! It has everything I need. I’m so glad I didn’t spend the big bucks for a fit bit. It holds a charge for days.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Not what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Didn't even try it when it came in I sent it back. I had gotten the smartwatch but it was having issues with it so I thought I would try one that had less bells and whistles but after receiving it was disappointed in the looks especially
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Found it not to be accurate
customer_reviews.text: After losing my fitbit in the parking lot at work and needing something temporarily to finish a work challenge, I purchased this watch. I only wore it for a week, because the lost fitbit was found. I did a comparison and wore both watches. I thought there was something off about this watch as I know the average steps I do daily. Fitbit recorded approximately 2,000 + steps more than this one. Currently sitting in the jewelry box.
customer_reviews.author: S Mosser

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive Option
customer_reviews.text: This is bare-bones. The clock doesn't come on when you need it to, but it pops on unexpectedly. So do the green lights underneath. I installed the mobile app. But it stops working.
customer_reviews.author: Lorna Collins

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, comfortable and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I use the Lintelek fitness tracker to track steps at work since I’ve taken on a more active position. It’s comfortable and easy to use and tracks the time, date and heart rate. The only problem I’ve found is it counts many non step movements that involve my arms. One battery charge can last over a week! I love mine!
customer_reviews.author: Pam Hooker

customer_reviews.title: Great device for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I have had the device for just a week, but so far so good. I am still learning how to use all of the features. It is slim in size, so not a huge screen, but still visible without problems. My only negative and the reason for the four stars is that it does not link to the wellness program app through my health insurance company, which is really what I wanted it for. Not a huge issue - I can still manually log the information.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just like a Fitbit, but less expensive
customer_reviews.text: My Fitbit would no longer hold a charge, so I went to order another one and ran across this. I was afraid it was cheap and wouldn't work or would look cheap, however, it's really nice and does the exact same thing the Fitbit does. The app you use with them is, again, like Fitbit and simple to use. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Derek VanHoose

customer_reviews.title: Good little tracker for the money
customer_reviews.text: For the money this seems to be a very good little tracker. This is the first tracker that I've owned. The accuracy of the steps is pretty spot on. The sleep tracker is pretty accurate as well, but the only thing I have noticed is if I am sitting still for a while (like reading a book or watching TV) it tends to show it as sleeping. This could be the tracker or I might have to read more about it since I have only used it a few days now.
customer_reviews.author: MA

customer_reviews.title: Nice tracker but, has some issues connecting
customer_reviews.text: The fitness tracker looks good, is comfortable to wear, and the battery life far exceeded the description. I got 7 days of battery life my first week of owning it. I got this tracker mainly for tracking workouts, heart rate and sleep. The problem is, I rarely get to log those things because it actually connects to the app about 10% of the time if that. So it kind of defeats the purpose of "tracking". If the app worked with the tracker, it would easily be a five star item for me.
customer_reviews.author: 96OBS444

customer_reviews.title: Fitness watch
customer_reviews.text: The fitness tracker seems to be working well I'm not too sure about the sleeping part of it how accurate it is but all and all for the price it seems to be pretty good
customer_reviews.author: Tony

product_meta.title: Lintelek Fitness Tracker Heart Rate Monitor, Activity Tracker, Pedometer Watch with Connected GPS, Waterproof Calorie Counter, 14 Sports Modes Step Tracker for Women, Men and Gift
feature_bullets: ❤ All-day Activity Tracking: Accurately record all-day activities like steps, distance, calories burned, active minutes and sleep status and with 14 sports modes, it helps you better understand each sport.

❤ Heart Rate and Sleep Monitoring: Automatically track your real-time heart rate continuously and sleep duration by comprehensively analyzing your sleep quality data to help you adjust your healthy lifestyle.

❤ Never Miss Call & Message: See Calls and Messages on Your Wrist, Receive call, calendar, SMS and SNS (Facebook, WhatsApp, Instagram, and Twitter ) notifications on display, never miss important messages.

❤ Multi-Sport Modes & Connected GPS: 14 exercise modes help you better understand specific activity data. Connect the GPS on your cellphone can show run stats like pace and distance and record a map of your workout route.

❤ Long-lasting Battery and Life Waterproof: IP67 waterproof activity tracker allows you to wear it in the rain or when washing hands (Don't wear while swimming). Full charge requires only about 1-2 hours and the standby time can be up to 5-7 days with ful

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
